Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday April 4), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing'

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, april 4th. 

first up, google is gearing up for a potential showdown with the european union's competition regulators. the tech giant is reportedly preparing to counter a new set of antitrust charges related to its online advertising practices. google is no stranger to hefty fines from the eu, as it has faced penalties exceeding $9 billion since 2017. 

in other news, amazon is expanding its healthcare footprint by launching its virtual medical care service, amazon care, across all 50 states. originally piloted for employees in the seattle area, amazon care will now offer telemedicine visits and in-person care across the u.s., aiming to provide an integrated approach to healthcare services. this move underlines amazon's continued push into the healthcare sector.

meanwhile, meta platforms is making headlines with its ambitious plans to introduce a suite of new mixed reality and virtual reality products by next year. ceo mark zuckerberg remains bullish on the metaverse's potential to transform social interactions and commerce, despite recent setbacks and financial challenges facing the company.

lastly, nvidia shares are climbing as analysts predict another standout quarter. with the growing demand for gpus in ai and data centers, nvidia continues to dominate key growth markets. the company aims to leverage its technological advantage to maintain strong revenue momentum.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, april 4th.

first on the agenda: google is bracing for a clash with the european union's competition regulators. the tech titan is reportedly preparing to contest a new wave of antitrust charges concerning its online advertising practices. this isn't google's first run-in with hefty penalties; since 2017, the eu has imposed fines exceeding $9 billion against them.

in other developments, amazon is broadening its healthcare reach by rolling out amazon care across all 50 states. initially piloted for employees in the seattle area, amazon care will now offer telemedicine consultations and in-person care nationwide. this expansion emphasizes amazon's strategic push into disrupting the healthcare industry.

turning now to meta platforms, which is generating buzz with its ambitious plans to launch a series of mixed reality and virtual reality products next year. ceo mark zuckerberg remains optimistic about the metaverse's potential to revolutionize social interactions and commerce, despite the company facing recent challenges and financial pressures.

lastly, nvidia shares are on an upward trajectory as analysts anticipate another standout quarter. the surge in demand for gpus, particularly in ai and data centers, positions nvidia as a leader in key growth markets. the company aims to capitalize on its technological prowess to sustain strong revenue momentum.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-250 Google's Eu Clash Over Ads ⚖️, Amazon Care's Nationwide Expansion 🏥, Meta's Vr Metaverse Ambitions 🌐
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, april 4th! catch up on today's key tech discussions:

  • google's antitrust battle: google is gearing up to contend with new antitrust charges by the eu over its online advertising practices, following previous fines of over $9 billion since 2017.
  • amazon care expansion: amazon broadens its healthcare services, launching amazon care across all 50 states, offering telemedicine and in-person care to disrupt the healthcare industry.
  • meta's mixed reality vision: meta platforms plans to launch a series of mixed and virtual reality products next year, as ceo mark zuckerberg champions the metaverse as a transformative platform for social interaction and commerce despite financial hurdles.
  • nvidia's upward momentum: nvidia shares are rising with expectations of another impressive quarter, driven by increased demand for gpus in ai and data centers, reinforcing its position in emerging growth markets.

don't forget to tune in for tomorrow's tech highlights!
Image Prompt: a unified podcast cover image featuring a dynamic cityscape at dusk, capturing the skyline of a european city. in the center, digital billboards and holographic advertisements hover above bustling streets, symbolizing the eu and google's clash over ads. to the left, a sleek, modern hospital building with a prominent amazon logo subtly integrated into the architecture, representing amazon care's nationwide expansion. in the background, the sky transitions into a starry night, revealing a vibrant virtual reality landscape, with interconnected digital pathways and avatars, embodying meta's vr metaverse ambitions. the elements blend seamlessly, creating a vivid composition that highlights the intersection of technology, healthcare, and digital worlds
